benchmark_details.name: TF-DCon (Training-Free Dataset Condensation for Content-based Recommendation)
benchmark_details.overview: TF-DCon is a novel training-free dataset condensation method designed for content-based recommendation (CBR). It synthesizes a compact dataset that maintains the performance of models comparable to those trained on large datasets, notably reducing dataset size while preserving user preference information.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To create a compact dataset for content-based recommendation that retains performance while being significantly smaller than the original datasets.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The performance can be unstable when utilizing ChatGPT for the pre-process due to network latency.

data.source: Real-world datasets including MIND, Goodreads, and MovieLens.
data.size: Condensed the size of original datasets by up to 95%.
data.annotation: Utilizes ChatGPT for interest extraction and item content condensation.

methodology.calculation: The metrics are calculated based on model performance on original datasets relative to those on condensed datasets.
methodology.interpretation: Higher NDCG and Recall indicate better performance of the recommendation models.
methodology.baseline_results: Achieved up to 97% of original performance while reducing dataset size by 95%.
methodology.validation: Extensive experiments conducted on multiple datasets.
